intro: Metrosideros collina var. imbricata, commonly known as the coastal rata, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of bright red or orange flowers. The leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a smooth texture and a glossy appearance. This species thrives in coastal environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils, and is well adapted to salt spray and strong winds. It plays an important ecological role in coastal ecosystems, providing habitat and food for native wildlife.
